Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dandelion1906
Reviews.Content: I have just returned home, after staying 3 nights at the Belgrove hotel. I don't like giving bad reviews about hotels, but in this case I feel I must. I paid £150 for 3 nights, not a lot of money to stay in a London hotel, some people might say. It's a lot of money to me and while I didn't expect the Ritz, I didn't expect to stay in a room with paper either hanging off the walls or scraped off part of the walls. In my opinion, if the owner couldn't be bothered to make the room presentable, then he/she didn't care about the guests who stayed there. There was no lampshade on the ceiling light, there were two plug sockets, but you had to get down on your hands and knees and stretch under a unit, if you wanted to plug in your hair dryer. There was no wardrobe to put your clothes in, there wasn't even a chair that you could use to hang your trousers over. There was 2 coat hangers and 5 hooks on the wall. There were holes in the tiles in the toilet, that had been plugged in with bits of paper. The television had 4 channels, but all the pictures were shadowy. Some might say you don't go to London to watch the television, well I am a 65yr old pensioner and I don't stay out late in the evenings. Because there was a television in the room, I should have been able to tune in to at least the 5 terrestial channels. I could only tune in to 4 channels and all 4 had poor reception. If the owner couldn't provide a watchable television, then he/she shouldn't have put a television in the room at all. Outside my room, there was a plug hanging off the wall. I prayed no toddler would see the plug and put their hands in the holes I went down to breakfast the first morning and was greeted with tea/coffee? No good morning, no smile. Then 2 rounds of toast were plonked on to my table and the waitress flounced off. The next morning, I had breakfast elsewhere and this morning, which was the morning I checked out, I just had two pieces of toast a cup of tea. I only had the toast, because I had to take tablets with food. I understand people have bad days, but when you are dealing with the public, in a service industry, you should deal with them with a smile on your face and in a polite manner. I have to say the room and bedlinen was clean, and the receptionists I met were polite. The hotel is also in a great location. I will not stay in this hotel again, I have stayed in plenty budget hotels, but this is the worst one I have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Sarah K
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night in a triple room - the room was extremely clean and tidy on arrival and had all the amenities we needed - TV, shower and toilet. The staff were very friendly and the breakfast included in the price was of a good quality. The room had a double bed and a single and had more than enough room. When reading the more negative reviews once I had booked I was slightly worried, but I am glas I gave The Belgrove a chance as it is an extremely comfortable hotel and is excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Think Again!”
Reviews.Author: julie g
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a one night stay in London and wanted somewhere close to Kings Cross. We have stayed in numerous BB hotels in London and this is by far the worse. Whilst I appreciate this is a budget BB I would at least expect cleanliness however the place is dirty , shabby and run down. We booked a double room and the bed was more a 3/4 size presumably to accomodate the tiny room size. At 3.30am the noise from other rooms started , people moving around, banging doors etc and this went on until around 5.45am. When we checked in we were earlier than the stated time but was told the room was ready as it had just been cleaned, despite this we found old socks under furniture ( had obviously been there a while!). This place needs closing down!!

Reviews.Title: “How are they allowed to get away with it ??????????????”
Reviews.Author: rob a
Reviews.Content: Needed a triple room close to Eurostar This hotel looked ideal when we looked at photos on website when we booked.Family arrived with one 6 year old daughter, straight away we noticed how dirty and run down the place was. It was obvious the photos on the website had been staged; the good reviewers on the site probably had that room. We did not dare to use the shower as it was totally inadequate and dangerous, I feared that my daughter would hurt her feet on the broken and lose tiles.The toilets filthy and without lighting. Our room was tiny and had not seen a cleaner for weeks .The mains to television taped up, there were broken cupboard doors, torn wallpaper with graffiti no light shades. I think your getting the picture. The bedding was clean . I know this hotel was cheap and was only used for somewhere to rest our heads before traveling to Paris ( we were never expecting the Ritz)., People will argue you get what you pay for. I feel however there is no excuse for the level of filth and lack of care we experienced.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STOP HERE !!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: trakyharry
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel mainly due to its location as it was very close to Kings Cross and the Eurostar terminal as i was on my own with my 2 children aged 9 and 4 on route to Disneyland Paris. On arrival a man on reception informed me that i was staying on the 4th floor no offer of help or any information regarding breakfast etc. After a long struggle with 2 cases 2 bags and 2 kids ( up lots of stairs) we arrived at room 45. It was next to the shower room (which i refused to use very dirty) and the toilet which was blocked after about an hour of our arrival and was still like that when we left. First impressions of the room were of shock i could not believe that a hotel would rent a room out in this condition. The back was hanging off the wardrobe the doors were hanging off, the drawers were broken and the wallpaper was brown with dirt. It was very hot and the windows wouldnt open either. In the morning we went down for breakfast the food was very basic. The bacon was overdone the beans cold and the coffee very bitter. The whole experience was horrible. I would never ever stay here again!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, decent for a budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: GIRLTHING63
Reviews.Content: Had to find a hotel near King's Cross at very short notice and within company budget. Anyone expecting the Marriott should book a room in the Marriott and pay their prices. This is a budget hotel in perfect location. Clean Excellent breakfast Room could do with a lick of paint and the bathroom ceiling was peeling, otherwise clean and in a good state of repair.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mf263
Reviews.Content: Glad we didnt read the reviews before we booked. Hotel is clean and the rooms are okay. Not amazing but what do you expect for such a low price in the Center of London. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very rude man at reception started asking things not relatet to booking.”
Reviews.Author: lape21
Reviews.Content: Pictures of room does not match in terms of reality .No shower lock or toilet lock,good luck if you want to go to loo(hardly a cat can fit in ,never mind the human).Sink tap half broken,doors have not seen basic rep. probably since 1950.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for transportation links”
Reviews.Author: Vancouver21
Reviews.Content: I needed easy access to King's Cross and Piccadilly lines (arriving from Heathrow, leaving on Eurostar), so this hotel was in a great location. Very basic, decent breakfast, but breakfast room is too small for number of guests so often had to wait. Desk clerks very friendly and helpful. No phone in room, which became a problem when my wallet/passport was stolen while travelling on the Tube. Free wireless Internet connection was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Tomonline
Reviews.Content: One would not choose this hotel for anything else apart from location. Kings Cross is a 2 minute hop, no taxi or other means of transport needed. Not much more than a bed to sleep in, breakfast was al-right. Although it was really noizy outside, with the single glazing windows not doing any favours, I slept really well just because I was absolutely exhausted. The hotel is in dire need of TLC. I would suggest to the management to close it down for a facelift, change of colours and they would probably be able to charge a lot more. A good place if you have business in Kings Cross or a train to catch, otherwise below average.

Reviews.Title: “Can't get any sleep! AWFUL!!!”
Reviews.Author: raul_alessio
Reviews.Content: Extremely small, a little bit dirty, but most of all, you can't get any rest here because there is a noise of the pipes in the walls that will keep you up all night! Even if you are exhausted and you think you'll fall asleep eventually, you won't! It can wake the dead people...

Reviews.Title: “Pile of poop”
Reviews.Author: Ashleigh16
Reviews.Content: Shared bathroom for a whole floor (around 10-15 people) - 1 toilet, 2 showers. The toilet wasn't cleaned for at least a day, and when we arrived there it was blocked from somebody's diarrhoea. The bed was fairly comfortable, but the paper thin walls meant you could hear anything the people next door were saying or watching on the TV. Breakfast was adequate - greasy but filling. We only stayed for two nights, but after the first we were contemplating reserving a room at another hotel. Great location right outside King's Cross & St. Pancras, however you get far less than what you pay for. Holes and tears in the bed sheets, and a blood stain from a previous guest on the curtain, along with no changing/washing of towels truly shows the care and attention the owners and employers put in to keeping the hotel running.

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL - AVOID”
Reviews.Author: zazazazazazaza
Reviews.Content: HOW did standards in Europe get so low compared to the rest of the world? People automatically think that things are better in richer countries but that is often far from the reality. This is particularly true in the leisure and hotel industries. This is reported as a 2* B&B. Not enough to describe it, do they give minus stars? If that existed I would give it a minus 2. But of course I am generous and also I am taking part responsibility for not taking heed of the other (i now know helpful) reviews on this website. If this existed in a country with higher overall standards, it would definitely not rank as 2*. In a nutshell: Horrible canteen like 'dining room' for breakfast. Breakfast itself looked worse than anything i would serve to prisoners on death row. (And i'm a conservative!) Single rooms are in the basement and look like cellars. I'm sure not long ago they stored logs in here. No wardrobe, no desk, no carpet, no rug, no toothbrush, no toiletries and the cup they gave looked like they'd saved the empty nutella glasses and decided to reuse them. Blanket about the thickness of a shower curtain. If you come in winter, bring antibiotics and be prepared to catch pneumonia. It's also so close to king's cross you can hear the trains trundling along every few minutes. Maybe it'll lull you sleep..and Unfriendly reception man... i could go on but i'll leave it to your imaginations ....

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay, simple as that!”
Reviews.Author: TinaHallberg
Reviews.Content: Having stayed twice at the Belgrove's sister hotel Euopean, I booked this for a 4-night stay with my husband. We had a small but clean room on the 2nd floor. The double bed was a bit small (would have been ok during any season but summer - we were in London during the heat wave in June 2009 and the ceiling fan didn't help much). Bathroom small but clean and functional. Small breakfast choice but tasty (though we went out for breakfast one day to Jamie Oliver's restaurant "Fifteen" which is just a few bus stops away). Friendly staff. The hotel's biggest advantage is its location - King's Cross right around the corner with easy access to all of London. Euston Station just around the corner as well - we were able to take the early morning train to Paris without having to travel through morning traffic. If I pay Â£60 a night I cannot expect the same quality that at a Â£200 hotel. Just saying. Come on people, be reasonable! Good value for your money; if you're after more comfort for Â£60 then London isn't the city for you!

Reviews.Title: “I would sooner sleep on the streets of King's Cross than stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: James1234007
Reviews.Content: I would sooner sleep on the streets of King's Cross than stay there again! I was forced to stay there as there was nowhere else. -The shower only had cold water. -The toilet was NOT securely fitted to the floor. It wobbled. -The single pane window banged against the frame all night. -The bed felt like it had been "put through it's paces" for the last 20 years - I had to ask for an extra duvet to sleep on top of. They could not provide this. -The corridors reeked of smoke from other guests/tortured victims -Sound travels well, very well. All of this luxury for the price of Â£65. I feel abused!

Reviews.Title: “Shabby but convenient”
Reviews.Author: littleanna777
Reviews.Content: I wanted to show London to my parents, so we booked 2 nights at The Belgrove Hotel, 1st night we stayed in quad room and second night in triple room. Room for 4, was really noisy as the windows were facing the front of the hotel, our room was on the ground floor, very small, toilet and shower was scary and did not look very clean. We were happy that the bed was quite comfy and clean bed sheets. Breakfast was cold and not really tasty, value sausages, jam was tasteless. Second night we moved in to triple room, which was a little bit better and quieter. I would not come back there, even though it was a great value for money with breakfast included and an en suite, very close to Kings Cross and convenient. Receptionists were very friendly and nice.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely disgusting”
Reviews.Author: JayHerts
Reviews.Content: I booked the EUROPEAN HOTEL but got there to find out they lost my reservation so they put me up in the Belgrove. I was not happy as researched both hotels on tripadviser and knew the belgrove wasn't good but there was nowhere else free at last minute that i could afford. I paid Â£55 for a single en suite in the European but got a triple in the belgrove...NOT as good a deal as you think..read on... the doors fire doors were propped open illegally with fire extinguishers. My room door didnt open fully into the bedroom - illegal again. the shower room had cracked broken tiles, open seals and the hot water took 5 mins of running to come thru. The toilet cubicle has a plastic cistern with cig burn marks all over it (non smoking room too!) and the place stunk of sewerage. The bin hadn't been emptied either. the bedroom was a double and single bed crammed into a small room with a small tv exposed pipes and wires strewn across the walls and floors trip hazard for an adult let alone a child. the room over looked roofs and backs of buildings with the smokers area right outside and the back of a fast food joint pumping stick into the room via the broken latched sash window. the walls and surfaces were marked and burned. the bed was ok comfy but had smells on the pillows and holes in the sheets, on my arrival a man was staying there and brought his "fiancÃ©e" for a visit - clearly a prostitute! Awful, awful place.

Reviews.Title: “Ok if you don't want to pay extra for a...”
Reviews.Author: Melmelgarfitt
Reviews.Content: Ok if you don't want to pay extra for a bit of luxury. Great location but beware that B&B literally does mean B&B!!! Rooms are small and "en suite" is a toilet in a cupboard! Breakfast redeems the hotel. Great if you need a base - get through your stay by remembering the standards you get camping for Â£10 a night ;-)

Reviews.Title: “tooooooo smaaaaaaaaallllllllllll!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Matsa_kis
Reviews.Content: We were three brothers and had to stay a night there, in order to catch up the train for Paris!!! The truth is that the location was perfect, as long as it was near the tube! BUT the rooms were xx small!!! No space to move and had to jump over beds to sleep!!! Plus that when we wanted to use the toilet our feet were outside the door!!! Moreover breakfast had hair all over!!! I would not recommend it for three people, maybe for two and if the do not mind the room to be that small!!!

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room with extremely tiny bathroom”
Reviews.Author: woanroulee
Reviews.Content: well the room afterall is clean , we 've got somebody to clean up our room everyday , (as a totaly of 2 days) , the bathroom wan't really a bathroom , and it's really a problem to us, i wasn't able to turn myself or move , the bathroom is really the tinest in the whole world , where am i going to put my toiletries? the breakfast , as others have mentioned was very good, juice/coffee/ scrambled eggs/ bacon/cheeze/toast etc. it was cheap, 30pounds per person at that time, so , if you are looking for a really cheap hotel and wouldn't care of anything else, you can choose this one.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money - Great Location - Fantastic Fry Up!”
Reviews.Author: gillej
Reviews.Content: I was on a budget trip to London and wanted a bed for the night near KX. For Â£50 I got a single room with en suite. Yeah it was small and yeah the walls were thin. But room 44 was very clean, the shower worked, the toilet worked (although had to sit on one side to get on) and the taps worked as did the littleTV. The bed was comfy enough and the temperature was OK. I have stayed in some 5* places that can't even get these things right. I cannot complain really for the money. Location was great; straight out of KX, over the road and there you are. The best bit was breakfast. If you are on a diet or want a crossant then this place isn't you. What I did get was afull fry up (incl in the price), toast and coffee. I was really happy with that. Couple of nice ladies doing the kitchen nice and effecietly. Again, I have paid 10x more and had some really crap eggs! Sorry; I actually was surpised; but then I had real low expectations.

Reviews.Title: “filthy disgusting dump”
Reviews.Author: denisetreacy
Reviews.Content: ignore photos,and discription! my single room was filthy , bare bulb, kettle did not fit under tap! had to put kettle on floor (nearest socket).,freezing cold,had to ask them to put heating on! wallpaper waterstained ,ripped! and scribbled on !fithy skirting boards, this room has not been decorated for at least 20 years! crawl down dark stairs for breakfast, food passable!checked out after one nite! have photos to back up my complaint!! if you need a budget hotel dont go here..its like a dump for the homeless!!

Reviews.Title: “Well I would stay again”
Reviews.Author: W3lshgirl
Reviews.Content: Cannot complain. Room & bedding clean, bed comfy, shower hot, staff were very friendly & accomodating. Breakfast brilliant. Location, well you couldn't get anywhere more convienient, Kings X Stn 2 mins, tube 2 mins, shops, food, everything you could want within easy walking. Yes the room was small, but we didn't come to London to sit in a hotel all the time. We had a wonderful break and will be booking at this hotel when we go back in the spring. Value for your money

Reviews.Title: “1 NIGHT SQUEEZE TIGHT”
Reviews.Author: dankeddle
Reviews.Content: we only stayed there one night because we had to get the eurostar the following morning just as well really the rooms three of us had to take it in turs to stand up it was that small, the beds were hard and un comfortable and slid around very basic, tea and coffee was in the rooms but above the bed, glad to get up after i got to sleep, i would'nt recomment this hotel to any member of the public at all i would take my business else where, the only descent thing was help yourself to breakfast which there was a vast majority of!!! you could stay there more than one night

Reviews.Title: “What a f* !”
Reviews.Author: Gato_Pacato
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife in this hotel for just a weekend (2 nights). I had to pay in advance altough it was not warned anywhere. The room was so tiny that I had to open my wifeÂ´s luggage (Medium Samsonite) on the bed. Ok. I expected a tiny room but it was to much. When the luggage was closed in the floor I have to overpass over the bed. The room and the hotel is clean. The blanket provided was filth and disgusting. So, if itÂ´s going to be cold, you will have to handle it. The shower was to weak that we can possible count all the drops falling. And demands time to heat the water. At least 5 minutes. A good thing in this hotel was the breakfast. Sausage, fried egg(easy on top), scrambled eggs, toast , butter, turkey bacon and Beans ! (also had juice, coffee and tea) The best thing is itÂ´s location. Like 20 steps from St. Pancras Intl Station. So, if you are coming by Eurostar, you will not need to take tube with luggage. Check-in 13:00 - Check-out : 11:00 Definitely we wouldnÂ´t stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice staff but not the most comfortable of hotels!”
Reviews.Author: UkPrincess13
Reviews.Content: I was on a girlie weekend in London and stayed at this hotel for 4 days. There was 4 girls so we all went for the cheaper twin rooms with separate shower and bathroom facilities. Here's my viewpoint, hope it helps! LOCATION: Fantastic! It's a 2 minute walk from Kings Cross Station. We didn't know London very well and this location was really central. I would recommend staying in the Kings Cross location for all attractions as you can get a main tube line to all the tourist sights from here. There's a cash point round the corner from the hotel and a Starbucks, McDonalds, Pret a Manger just up the road on the right hand side so we were extremly happy with the location 10/10 for us! HOTEL ROOMS: We specifically went for twin bed rooms and rooms next to each other (we had numbers 46 & 47). Our room was shockingly small it literally just fitted 2 tiny twin beds, half a wardrobe a tiny sink and no room for your suitcases so we couldn't even unpack! Not a recommended choice if you plan on coming back to the hotel to relax. Also TV only has 4 channels (if you are lucky). The window wouldn't open fully and the whole hotel was extremly hot - it felt like a sauna the whole time! Our friends room was better they were given a 'family room' Be warned! This is NOT family sized! But it was a great size for 2 people to share (I would recommend asking for a family room if I was staying here). It had a double bed (which was small) and a small twin bed, sink, chest of drawers, small cupboard and 2 windows which opened fully (as I said, hotel was like a sauna!). BATHROOMS: Can't comment on the on suite rooms as we opted for the really cheap rooms with shared toilet/shower facilities. Not a good idea! Luckily we are all easy going and got on with it but some people might come here and decide to leave if they are not used to these kind of facilities. The toilet and shower room were separate and absolutely tiny more like small cupboards. I would say if you were a slightly larger person you would not appreciate these small facilities. Showers worked okay and there was always hot running water but some of the toilets didn't flush very well. There are NO LIFTS in the hotel so please be aware of this if you have large, heavy suitcases and are put on the 3rd floor as there's 3 flights of windy stairs which are very small and kind of claustrophobic, so I would say this hotel is not suitable if you have difficulty walking. STAFF are nice and friendly and the breakfast is resonable. Although again breakfast area was small, dingy and very warm. Everything was clean but everything also needed a good lick of paint and redecorating the whole place looks very tired. To summarise this hotel is okay if you just want a bed for a night but not if you are the sort of person who likes to relax in a hotel room to take a break from London's hectic tourist stuff! I wouldn't stay here again. Would probably stay at the hotel a couple of doors down (not sure of it's name) but they are offering all on suite rooms at a very good hotel rate as well and we went into the lobby to have a look and it looked a much nicer hotel. I would not recommend this hotel unless you are used to staying in hostel type of places or you don't care what your hotel is really like. A good central base for travelling and tourist stuff for London and a good hotel price but that's about it.

Reviews.Title: “Belgrove, Forget it.”
Reviews.Author: maineevent
Reviews.Content: Bad hotel. stayed deep in the bowels of the place. no light working in toilet or shower. No light working in bedroom on the last day. If there was a fire you would be out of luck. Toilet and shower room feet away from where folks are having breakfast, which makes for some interesting smells. Save your time and money go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Belgrove good location OK for a few nights”
Reviews.Author: LionelMeadows
Reviews.Content: I was staying at another hotel round the corner but wasn't too happy so decided to try this place. I went in about 9am on a Friday to ask about rooms and the receptionist who was I believe from Latvia was really nice and friendly. She had two basic rooms available one basement one top floor at Â£35 but when I asked to see them she said I'd have to come back after 11am. I went back in the evening about 6pm and another girl on reception who was from London gave me a key to see the basement room but wouldn't let me see the other room at the top as she said they were all the same. They just cannot be helpful can they ? What is it about some Londoners that they make an effort to be as unhelpful as they possibly can ? Anyway booked one night for the basement room for the Sunday to try it. Arrived Sunday afternoon and the basement room was OK.Room size was fine tv worked towel and soap but no plug for the sink( no big deal). Toilet at the end of the corridor but for me on my own that's fine. I just want a cheap room and Â£35 is OK as it's a good location. Stayed for two more days but on the last day there were some builders staying there in other basement rooms and if the windows are open even if their tv is low you still hear it. Fortunately the builder guy turned it off about 11pm as he had to get up early next morning. Breakfast was OK you help yourself to the eggs,bacon, sausage etc. The orange juice is actually orange squash mixed with cold water. If you fill up on breakfast you don't need that much for the rest of the day. I wish hotels were a bit more strict about noise I had to move to the Belgrove because the previous hotel round the corner had someone playing their tv at 4am. When I've been in hotels in the US and had to complain about noise they've dealt with it immediately. I travelled by train from Aberdeen to KX so just crossing the road to this hotel was very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “crap!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: loopylooBirmingham
Reviews.Content: this hotel has got to be the worst i have ever stayed in, i only stayed the one night thank god but never again, yes it was near the train station but i would walk 2 mile to get to the train station rather then ever stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and grim!!!”
Reviews.Author: kimANDian
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner decided to take a last minute xmas trip to london, we found this hotel and thought it would do for the money for one night. Never in our nightmares did we expect what we got. First of, the lady on reception didnt greet us at all and was incredibly rude, then told us our room was up the stairs, which ended up taking us ages to find as none of the endless doors on the grotty stinking stairs have labels, even the cleaner didnt know where it was! we eventually got to our tiny damp ridden room with torn carpet, pealing off wall paper and unusable equipment. It was that bad we didnt even dare shower. The only clean thing was the sheets, thank god! Oh yeah dont try and store your luggage their and they just leave in in the corridor and blame you for lost items!!! As you might have guessed we didnt risk having breakfast. All i can say is, the extra cost for somewhere else is well worth it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Way too basic”
Reviews.Author: Mike170
Reviews.Content: Hi, I booked via the internet and found this hotel to be so basic that it is beneath what I am used to for basic creature comforts. The room was very small, the furniture old and so were the carpets. The window could not be closed, so I was cold all night. The sheets were clean and a clean towl was provided. The toilet had a flush handle made of chain links but no wooden or plastic handle at the end. It was shared by all in that corridor. There were 3 showers but I did not use them as there was nowhere to place the change of clothes as switching on the shower was going to wet the whole room which was small. There was no soap dish in the shower room. There was no towel hanger either. Just a hook on the door of the shower room which was bascially a shower head in an enclosed tiled room with no window and the ceiling paint was peeling. Breakfast was substantial in the morning. But minimum standards. We had hot food with minisausages, fried eggs, bacon, toast with butter, tomato and baked beans. The receptionists and canteen staff spoke what sounded like Russian. They were trying their best, but it is the state of the place and the management that needs to be sorted out. Hope that helps, at least you know what you're paying for. Yes it is close to the train station but perhaps we could have stayed at better accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “belgrove met all of my needs”
Reviews.Author: toddyoh
Reviews.Content: shame on all the bad reviews!! sure, the room was small; but, it was very well located and very reasonably priced--65 pounds/night. someone was at the desk 24/7. i liked the breakfast. the water pressure in the shower was a bit weak, but if that is my only complaint . . .

Reviews.Title: “hovel is right”
Reviews.Author: jbeano21
Reviews.Content: I have been to europe several times b/4 and never stayed in a hotel that made me want to go out and immediately search for another room. It was on the 5th floor and smelled of food and nothing worked(lights , tv...). The staff was very helpful the next morning and we got a larger room on the 1st floor and everything worked in it. The breakfast was not appealing in an overheated room so we ate elsewhere. I would not book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “This place is the pits. Period.”
Reviews.Author: BigAudio
Reviews.Content: Me and a friend booked a single night at this hovel (yes, HOVEL - it's not a spelling mistake) as a last minute cheap alternative to one of the places we would normally have stayed at in London (mental note - always book early, avoid HOVELS...) We'd checked out reviews for The Belgrove which seemed to be fairly OK (prior to booking!) which suggested it was cheap and cheerful but at least clean, so we decided to give it a go - what a mistake that was. The place must have seriously hit the skids since those reviews had been made, or failing that it would suggest that the previous reviewers had been paid off! The staff were rude & surly, the place was really dirty and stunk to high heaven - I wouldn't have kept pigs in there. Even if you need somewhere as a last resort, I'd avoid this place like the plague and sleep in the park around the corner!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and basic hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: adderi
Reviews.Content: Belgrove hotel i situated right next to the St. Pancras and King's Cross tube & rail stations - Unbeatable location. Booked single room and stayed for 3 nights. Room was small but big enaugh for one person as it should be :-) Price was excellent (50 GBP/night) and was including breakfast. Breakfast: coffee/tea, cornflakes, eggs, scrambled eggs, sausages, 2x toast, beans, bacon and some red stuff. Besides coffee there is only too strong orange juice available - no water. Breakfast ends exactly at 9am and not a minute later. The staff were Eastern European and showed no special interest to their job. Day time receptionist girl was pretty and she gave a smile. Nice. In overall the hotel is good value for money: excellent location, rooms are clean, shower has warm water and you get breakfast. easy to reach from all London airports. Will recommend to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “There's cheap and cheerful, and then there's The Belgrove....”
Reviews.Author: The_Secret_Traveller
Reviews.Content: I booked a night at this (ahem) hotel as a cheap and cheerful alternative to one of the usual places I stay in the area as they were all unfortunately fully-booked. I'd checked out a couple of customer reviews to see what the overall opinion was, which all appeared to be along the lines of "it's OK, basic but clean", etc. Good Lord, either this place has seriously gone downhill since the reivews or these people must need glasses! I and my wife had the misfortune of staying at a place in Kensington at the beginning of the year (if you see my review of the Eden Plaza), but this place comes a very close second. It was dirty, it smelt, the room was so small I could just about turn around in it, it was falling to bits (Steptoe would have had a field day). If you're (a) absolutely desperate, and (b) have no other option, then this hotel is OK as a last resort - I can't comment on the breakfast room as I was rather concerned over the cleanliness of the place and didn't want to risk it! Honesty's the best policy!!

Reviews.Title: “Could have been worse, but could have been much better too”
Reviews.Author: spiralis
Reviews.Content: I spent one night in the Hotel Belgrove, and was kind of relieved that it was one night only. The overall look of hall, staircase and corridors were shabby . The room was really small and shabby too. But sheets were clean and the bed was ok, and although the bathroom had a little mould problem, it was cleaned. The TV screen was grainy and only few channels was watchable. Breakfast was ok and staff was quite disregardable. Location was very good. Because of the reviews, I was expecting even worse, but I was, if not gladly surprised, but relieved that I could spend there one night without a problem. If you are expecting something fancy or even nice, it is not place for you, but if you just need a roof over your head, it is ok. But you can get nicer options in the price, even in London.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: Klidimos
Reviews.Content: The worst place my girlfriend and I have ever been (and we travel a lot)!!! Its really a waste of money, very insecure and not safe at all with such tiny corridors. This place was worse than a maze! Dirty [--] and blankents???!!!!!!! Yes, there was no duvet!! Just a filthy blanket. AVOID at all costs!

Reviews.Title: “belgrove nightmare”
Reviews.Author: pheasantBath
Reviews.Content: Dirty and small rooms, moody staff. Spend an extra 20 pounds and go to another hotel. This place is horrible, DONT STAY AT THE BELGROVE HOTEL..

Reviews.Title: “nightmarish hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mia1999
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a single room for 45 pounds, but felt i threw my money away for nothing. The reception was very moody, and the room was worse. Bed sheets was dirty, and the bathroom was smelly and scummy. (I recommend to bring a beach sandal!) The lock on the room's door seemed to be insecure. The breakfast was English breakfast, but it was terrible as well. Especially, the seemed-like orange juice was something which I had never tasted before! I still wonder what it was really.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base for exploring London”
Reviews.Author: RustyCatLeeds
Reviews.Content: I was slightly worried about this hotel given the terrible reviews it has but now i have stayed there i have realised how high peoples expectations are for a 60 quid a night hotel!! . There is nothing wrong with this hotel if all you will be using it for is to shower and sleep. Breakfast is lovely, nice staff, excellent location, clean room, hot shower..room is small but who cares? 1 minute walk from Kings Cross tube station means you can get anywhere in London in no time at all. I would 100% recommend this hotel and will definitley stay there on my next trip to London.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare !!!!”
Reviews.Author: Meaw
Reviews.Content: I should have believed the comment below and cancel our booking before. We stayed there only for one night so we thought it should be OK. However, it turned out to be terrible and more tiring holiday of our life. We couldn't help to write a review the first thing we arrived home. First of all, there was a bad impression when entering the room. There was bad smell of cigarette in the very tiny hallway. Not only the room was so small, our en-suite toilet and shower was only the size of public loo with the toilet lid cannot hold open. Our blanket is too small that it couldn't even cover two of us and so thin that it didn't make us any warmer. Even worse... there was no heat at all from the radiator. So we couldn't sleep well all night. I can imagine how horrible it will be in winter night. Only the breakfast was ok and the location was good. Oh one last thing, the lady reception is so ignorant. When we returned the key, she didn't even speak a word. Believe me, if you haven't booked, go somewhere else. Otherwise it may end up like us.. nightmare.

Reviews.Title: “not again”
Reviews.Author: yepitsme
Reviews.Content: booked for 2 nights (single bed) the toilet is very small same goes for the 'shower' where you could barely turn around. the shower ceiling was all rotten. the 'tv' had 3 channels none of them were working all i got was snow. check out my pics what you will get if you book this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Not again”
Reviews.Author: AK77
Reviews.Content: Small room, furniture almost falling apart, grotty carpet, tiniest bathroom ever. Good security, nice breakfast, good location, but I would not recommend this hotel.
